data:
Terry, Paul W Paul W Terry pwterry@wisc.edu (608) 263-0487 3283 Chamberlin Hall Plasma Plasma and neutral fluid turbulence in fusion and astrophysics using analytical theory and computation to study basic processes including the role of flow shear on turbulence and transport; physics of intermittency, coherent structures, and granular structures in plasma turbulence; spectral transfer; and role of damped modes in turbulence saturation and dissipation ranges. Directions to room 3283, Chamberlin Hall or stairs to the 3rd floor. Facing into the hallway, away from the two elevators, turn left. Go to the first hallway that connects on your right. Follow the hallway to room 3283, which will be on your right.
